prompt: <description>**CAD Model Generation Instructions:** **Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Use the given Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane.** This sketch will be used to create the base of the prism. 3. **Create a rectangle in the sketch.** This rectangle is defined by four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.625] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.625] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Use the sketch scaling parameter 0.75. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Use the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** Use an extrusion depth of 0.125 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Use the sketch scaling parameter 0.75. The resulting shape should be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and dimensions of approximately 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.125 units. **Part 2: Rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a curved side** 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Use the given Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.4375, 0.125]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane.** This sketch will be used to create the base of the prism. 3. **Create a rectangle in the sketch.** This rectangle is defined by four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.1875] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.1875], End Point [0.0, 0.1875] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.1875], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch.** Use the sketch scaling parameter 0.75. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch.** Use the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model.** Use an extrusion depth of 0.5625 towards the normal and no extrusion in the opposite direction. Use the sketch scaling parameter 0.75. The resulting shape should be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, a curved side, and dimensions of approximately 0.75 x 0.75 x 0.5625 units. **Final Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a central circular hole, slightly tilted to the right** 1. **Combine the two parts using a Join Feature Operation.** This will create a single solid body with the rectangular prism and curved prism attached. 2. **Create a circular hole in the combined shape.** This hole should be centered horizontally and vertically, and should pass through both prisms. The hole should be slightly offset to the right to create a tilted effect. The dimensions of the final shape should be approximately 2 x 3 x 4 units.</description>
completion:

</json>

Draw a 2D sketch on this coordinate system, and create two faces, face_1 and face_2. 3. In face_1, create a loop (loop_1) with the following curves (line_1, line_2, and line_3) in order: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.2022] - line_3: Start Point [0.375, 0.2022], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. In face_2, create a loop (loop_1) with the following curves (line_1, line_2, and line_3) in order: - line_1: Start Point [0.375, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.375, 0.2022] - line_3: Start Point [0.375, 0.2022], End Point [0.375, 0.0] 5. Extrude the 2D sketch by a depth of 0.0174 towards its normal vector and 0.0 opposite its normal vector. This represents the 'NewBodyFeatureOperation' that combines the current sketch into the previous assembly. This part has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 meters - Width: 0.0174 meters - Height: 0.75 meters These instructions provide sufficient detail for the junior CAD designer to create the parametric CAD model of part 1 based on the given JSON.</description>

The length of this part is 0.75, the width is 0.75, and the height is 0.3. Now, proceed with the next part of the CAD model.</description>
